headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Brad Raffensperger is Interviewed about Georgia Voting; Woman Gored by Bison; Josh Shapiro is Interviewed about his Race for Governor; Jennifer Coolidge is Interviewed about Acting. Aired 8:30-9a ET

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Be able to get out and vote.BRAD RAFFENSPERGER (R), GEORGIA SECRETARY OF STATE: Well, you made a very key point when you said about during the pandemic. During the pandemic we had 25 percent of the people, you know, were voting absentee. And that's why, as an emergency measure, drop boxes were put in to as an administrative rule. But that went out after the senatory (ph) runoffs. They weren't allowed. And so for the very first time they're actually codified and put into state law. We're now back to about 6 percent to 7 percent of the people voting absentee. So the numbers are down by 80 percent of who's voting absentee.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But why wouldn't that be something that you would learn from if it worked during the pandemic? It doesn't mean just because you had the pandemic. Maybe this was something that actually worked and you would learn from it and say, wow, look how many people we gave access to, to voting. No?

utterances.speaker: RAFFENSPERGER
utterances.sentences: Yes, and now we have 80 percent less people voting absentee. They're based on population. You get one for every 100,000 voters.And then, obviously, next session, the general assembly can look at it and should that be tweaked, should there be a few more drop boxes. But it's population based. Every county has to have one. Back in 2020 we had nearly 40 counties that did not have a single drop box. Now every county has to have a drop box. But the fact of the matter is, we have safe and secure elections, we have photo ID for absentee voting, photo ID for in-person voting. We have record turnout. It's never been easier to register. We have record registrations. We have 6.9 million registered voters -- active registered voters and it looks like to me we will probably be pushing well over 4 million, which is what we had in 2018. We won't hit the presidential number of 5 million, but, still, we're showing that it's here as the proper guardrails and accessibility and we believe that we're the model for election integrity but also election access. LEMON: Yes, everyone will be paying attention.

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's remarkable the numbers. And when I interview Governor Kemp, he told me the same thing. He said that this is proof that what President Biden and what other Democrats have said about that new election law is wrong.Brad Raffensperger, we appreciate your time. Thank you for joining us. We know you've got a lot of early voting going on, so we'll let you get back to that in Georgia.

utterances.speaker: RAFFENSPERGER
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Thanks so much.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: All eyes will be on the state where he is, Georgia, coming up on Tuesday.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: A couple of votes (ph). Arizona but Georgia is a big one as well.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: But coming up in the next few minutes, we have caught on camera this Texas woman who was gored by a bison in a state park. You'll hear what was happening, her thoughts, right as this attack was underway.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh! Oh my God!(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Have you seen the video. That's my - this morning (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I haven't (ph) seen it. It's crazy.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It's crazy.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You're going to have to see this one - this next one to believe it. And I'm sure -

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It hurts me.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm sure this woman could not believe what happened. But, guess what, she lived to tell about it. You would say she's lucky to be alive, but I don't think this is, you know, very lucky there.She was gored by a bison. You may recall Rebecca Clark shared a video of the attack last month that exploded on social media. And CNN's Ed Lavandera spoke with her. Ed joins us now from Texas. Ed, what a crazy experience.

utterances.speaker: ED LAVANDERA, CNN SENIOR NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Yes, you know, Rebecca Clark's survival story is that, it's quite an amazing survival story. But it is more than that. It really puts the spotlight on decades of efforts to save one of the most iconic animals in North America.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) LAVANDERA (voice over): Walking under the vibrant sky and rustic cliffs of Caprock Canyon State Park feels like a journey into a lost age. In this corner of west Texas, this sprawling land is home to a herd of southern plains bison, a species that centuries ago dominated the landscape. Today, it's a park where the bison and the human roam.

utterances.speaker: REBECCA CLARK, HIKING ENTHUSIAST
utterances.sentences: So this is kind of just my memory wall.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: Last month, Rebecca Clark visited the park for a week of solo hiking.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: That's actually him.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: She didn't think the experience would end up immortalized on this wall.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I want to remember that time and all the things that happened.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: It's a story she's lucky to tell.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Come on, keep going. I just want to get by, OK.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: Clark recorded on her phone as she crossed paths with bison roaming past a trail, much closer than the 50-yard minimum distance recommended.LAVANDERA (on camera): At what point did you realize you were in trouble?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Well, I think it's when I used profanity in my video.Thank you. I appreciate it. When I saw him turn, it's like instantly I knew he was going to come after me. Oh, no. Oh, (EXPLETIVE DELETED)! Oh! Ah! Oh! Oh, my God! LAVANDERA (voice over): The bison gored Clark in the back.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: It was so fast. He hit me in the back. Rammed me, hooked me, and then flipped me up face forward into a mesquite bush.LAVANDERA (on camera): What is going through your mind at that time?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I thought I was paralyzed.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: You've kept the backpack intact.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. This is my backpack. I might wash it eventually. But I had to eat a lot of humble pie for this one.LAVANDERA (voice over): The bison's horn cut a wide gash in her back.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I still know that I was too close. You know, I wasn't as diligent as I should have been.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: Clark posted her video on TikTok. It went viral. And it also put the spotlight on this unique state park.

utterances.speaker: DONALD BEARD, SUPERINTENDENT, CAPROCK CANYON STATE PARK
utterances.sentences: The bison are definitely the keystone species.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: Donald Beard is the superintendent of Caprock Canyon State Park and a passionate advocate of growing bison herd populations across the country.

utterances.speaker: BEARD
utterances.sentences: It's really cool to be able to drive though this park and have bison walk across the road in front of you and see them and know the history of them.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: In the 1870s, the Texas bison were decimated in the great slaughter. But famed ranchers Charles and Maryann Goodnight (ph) saved a few. The descendants of those bison were bred and kept on a private ranch for decade.In 2011, the park released the bison to begin roaming freely through much of this 15,000 acre park. Since then, Beard says, the herd grew from 80 animals to 350.

utterances.speaker: BEARD
utterances.sentences: The song "give me a home where the buffalo roam," that's where we live.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: Visitors are warned repeatedly to keep their distance. Here, the bison are king.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry. Gosh, I can't believe you did this to me.I'm trying to protect the opportunity to go experience nature. LAVANDERA (voice over): This is what makes Rebecca Clark emotional. She'd be devastated if her encounter prevents others from this bison experience. LAVANDERA (on camera): You love the outdoors that much? No, I think that's --

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes. Wow.

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: I am so sorry. I --

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: No, it's that ah-ha moment for me there. So, yes, I hope I didn't -

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Keep somebody else from that.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: So, guys, Rebecca Clark says she is well on her way to recovery. That she'll be hiking again, enjoying the outdoors here by - by - pretty soon, by the end of the year. And Donald Beard there, the superintendent of the park, says that his goal is to increase the bison population herd here in Texas up to 2,000, but he needs to find other places across the southern plains where these animals can continue to thrive.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Ed Lavandera, thank you very much. Appreciate that.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Ed.President Biden and former Presidents Trump and Obama all traveling, guess where, to Pennsylvania this weekend in a last-ditch effort to energize voters before Tuesday's election. Will it make a difference? Pennsylvania's attorney general, candidate for governor, Josh Shapiro, is here next. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: All right, as we reported earlier, a really telling new CNN poll shows Republicans with quite an advantage just days away from the midterms. And, guess what, it's the economy, stupid. Remember that?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And it is again. Fifty-one percent of voters say that is their big number one issue. It's not even a close second.Joining us now to talk about the economy and a whole lot more, Pennsylvania Democratic candidate for governor Josh Shapiro. Thank you so much for being with us this morning. And let's talk about the economy. So much of this, as you know, is about inflation. And you've got a Democrat in the White House. You've got Democrats controlling the House and the Senate and inflation is out of control. My question to you is, as governor, there's not a lot you can do to deal with inflation, but you do oversee all these state agencies, right, that deal with tax policy, that deal with grants, that deal with aid to those suffering. What would you do, as governor, to help people struggling with the economy, with inflation? JOSH SHAPIRO (D-PA), GUBERNATORIAL. CANDIDATE: Well, look, obviously this is not an issue created by the governor of the commonwealth or, you know, the state lawmakers. But I do think we have a responsibility to address it, to bring down costs for Pennsylvania families. That's why many months ago I leaned in on this issue and put forth a concrete plan to reduce costs for Pennsylvanians. First, we would cut business taxes. Second, we'd get rid of those nuisance taxes here in Pennsylvania, like the cell phone tax. Every Pennsylvanian with a cell phone pays 11 percent more on their bill each month. Third, we're going to double what's known as the property tax rent rebate and double the number of seniors that are eligible for it. That's going to help seniors with rising costs be able to stay in their homes. And finally, for those who are dealing with pain at the pump, I want to give them all an immediate $250 gas tax rebate. You have two cars, $500 and so on and so forth. The bottom line here is, we have to cut costs for Pennsylvania families.

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: This problem may not have come from Pennsylvania, but I think we need to address it here. And I'm the only candidate that's put forth a plan to do just that.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Since we're on this poll, OK, and let's take a look at what's happening here. You -- the economy, number one, right, and it's always, as James Carville said, the economy, stupid. We get that. But surprising - so Democrats are running on abortion. It is number two. But it is a far number two, 51 percent, economy, 15 percent for abortion. And crime, if you look at the Republican message, it's 3 percent. It's at the bottom of the list.What is the disconnect here for Democrats on abortion and Republicans on crime?

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: Look, I can't speak for national Democrats or national Republicans. I can speak to what I hear in Pennsylvania every day. And I would just tell you, I think Pennsylvania voters, Republican and Democrat, they know how to walk and chew gum at the same time, Don. They can care about rising costs. They can also care about their personal freedoms. And those personal freedoms are under attack with this dangerous extreme opponent that I'm running against who wants to ban and criminalize all abortion with no exception.So, I lean in on protecting personal freedoms and also talking about the economy and crime. I'm proud to be endorsed by prosecutors of both parties, by local police all across Pennsylvania. I've got a plan to hire 2,000 more police officers across this commonwealth, properly trained and from the communities that they are sworn to protect because people have a right to both be safe and feel safe in our communities. I think we do all of that together. And that's why we've seen so many Republicans join with Democrats and independents in supporting our campaign.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: There is so little common ground, but I'm sort of fascinated by the fact that you and your competitor, Doug Mastriano, actually agree on a lot when it comes to the economy. You agree - both want to cut taxes. You actually want to cut corporate tax more -- almost twice as much as he does. You want to cut the corporate tax rate 4 percent by 2025. He wants to cut it 2.5 percent by 2030. You're campaigning on that bus. President - with President Biden, who has talked in the last week about corporate war profiteering. He said, let's make sure the wealthiest corporations pay their fair share.I know Pennsylvania has the second highest corporate tax rate in the country, but you and the president seem on sort of a different page. Are you?

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: Well, look, I'm not paying a whole lot of attention to what the president's plan is or what people in Washington, D.C., are paying attention to or talking about. I'm focused on what Washington County, Pennsylvania, needs. And what they need right now is more money in their pocket. If we're going to spur economic growth here, then we need to cut taxes and raise wages. That goes hand in hand. I think that's a common-sense approach that's going to help our economy. And that's what I'm focused on, the people of Washington County, not the noise coming out of Washington, D.C.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: And I know President Biden is coming to campaign with you on Saturday. We see you have been on this bus tour I know across - we see the bus behind you. It looks a little chilly there.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Wait, what - what bus tour? There's a big, giant -

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: It's right there.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: It's right there.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: You can't -

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: You all are welcome to join me any time.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Hey, we might come down and just do that.I want to -

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: Do the morning show from the bus.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Maybe we will.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Do you think you can fit all three of us on there?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: We had an Election Express here in, I don't know - you remember the Election Express?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, remember that?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: But can I -- can I ask you about something that we are seeing from our reporters on the ground in Pennsylvania, and this is really fascinating to me.

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: And they are hearing from voters who -- you are deeply popular, your polls aren't even really that close -- who are voting for you for governor but when it comes to the Senate, they are voting for Mehmet Oz. What do you make of that?

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: Look, Kaitlan, we'll see what voters ultimately do at the end of the day. Obviously, I'm for John Fetterman. And you couldn't have a clearer contrast in both of these races. But I'm focused on making the case against Doug Mastriano, who's by far the most dangerous and extreme candidate running in the nation.I think if you look at Pennsylvania's history, though, our voters are discerning. We've seen a long history of ticket splitting across Pennsylvania. I'm proud of the fact that so many Republicans have joined with Democrats and independents in supporting me. Look, I think they recognize this is a moment where we've got to take off the red jersey and the blue jersey and just wear the Pennsylvania jerseys. With everything that's at stake, with our personal freedoms being threatened by the likes of Doug Mastriano, with our democracy that was born right here in the commonwealth of Pennsylvania, 246 years ago, under attack. We need to stand tall around the values that we hold dear, democracy, freedom and our love of this country. And that's something that's uniting Republicans, Democrats, and independents behind my candidacy, and I'm honored to have that support.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: But what's at stake -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You know what I think the biggest lesson here is in this - go on. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: I've got one question about - about that because you said you are supporting John Fetterman and --

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: I thought Don - Don was about to drop some knowledge on (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I was about to drop some knowledge, but Kaitlan has a question for you. I'll droop it after Kaitlan.

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: OK. Sorry. Go ahead. [08

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Don -- Don is always dropping knowledge.

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: But I do have a quick question -

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: Go ahead, Kaitlan.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Because you said that you're supporting John Fetterman and, you know, you talked about what's at stake in this race. Do you believe that John Fetterman, though, to assuage voters' concerns, should have his doctors brief the press?

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: That's obviously a decision John's going to make. I'll actually be with him tonight in State College. We'll be rallying students at Penn State. But that's ultimately his call.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Knowledge drop time.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, my knowledge drop time was - and it is, look, I think the biggest lesson in here is (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: Give it to us, Don.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's branding. You've got the bus and you've got the jacket and you stayed on message.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Don's going to -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You're like this -- this isn't about this person, it's about me. It's not about what's happening in the nation, this is about what's happening to the people in Pennsylvania.Staying on message, but I'm jut - I'm making a joke about your branding, but nice jacket, by the way.

utterances.speaker: SHAPIRO
utterances.sentences: Well, Don, if - if Don Lemon knows how to dress. So, if you like the Ted Lasso puffer coat, that's a - that's a good deal here, Don. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It's like -- you don't even know what a challenge it is to keep up with this.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Josh Shapiro, thank you so much for joining us from your bus tour this morning. We look forward to paying attention closely to Pennsylvania.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you. LEMON

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Oh, this is a good one. She has acted in classics, "Legally Blonde," "American Pie," two of my favorite movies, and Don had the chance to talk to her, Jennifer Coolidge, the one and only. We'll have her interview, ahead.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: She's fun.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: JENNIFER COOLIDGE, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God, you look like the Fourth of July. That makes me want a hot dog real bad.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, OK. Well -(END VIDEO CLIP) (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm a huge, huge fan of yours.

utterances.speaker: JENNIFER COOLIDGE, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Is that OK? Can I fan out a little bit?

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: Please. Yes, why not? Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You're an Emmy Award winner. You've been on the big screen. You've been on the small screen. And now you're this streaming star holding it down on HBO and Netflix.What is that like?

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: It's way more enjoyable if you never expected the moment to happen. So, I just - you know, I think it's the surprise of it all that makes it so fun just because I just - I truly believe, if I had expected this all to happen, it never would have happened. I think - I don't know. I don't -- who knows? And, you know what, sometimes I think, I don't even want to analyze it because I don't want to jinx it. It's just this weird, you know, lucky moment. LEMONat, you know, at a ripe young age of we won't say, but -

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes. Don't say.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Because Hollywood is such a -- it's like youth.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: I mean, I think one of the reasons I think people have had such a maybe a big response on both -- sort of both shows that sort of, you know, came out and stuff like that is that I think a lot of people, you know, even especially - I think Covid had something to do with it. It's like, I think a lot of people want to feel like they have a chance at something, that maybe they thought it was a missed chance. And I think I'm a good example of that.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: And I am deeply, deeply insecure. I know a lot of rich white (EXPLETIVE DELETED) up people.So, let's have fun, OK? (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: When you think about -- about "White Lotus," right -

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Because the success that happened during Covid and everybody was watching. I watched it, actually binge watched it, when I had Covid.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: You did?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And so I was watching it as I had Covid and I was like, I want to be in Hawaii with them. And then, I said, these are such awful people, I don't know, but I'd still like to be in that beautiful place.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: Yes, we were - we - yes, a lot of us were awful. I mean not some -- some of us not intentionally awful, but, yes, we're just spoiled -- spoiled rotten.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Why do you think it was such a success? Do you think it was because of Covid or -- obviously it's because it's a great series.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: I think Mike White has this - you know, is very tapped in to who people are and how to tell a story. I think he -- his stuff is very real. And then we had a lot of, you know, strong feelings for Murray Bartlett's character, the - you know, sympathize being, you know, in - and, you know, look, I was a cocktail waitress right up until my 30 - in my - right before I got Stifler's mom.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: Are you trying to seduce me? EDDIE KAYE THOMAS, ACTOR(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And the big screen, at least what I came to know you as a sex symbol, as Stifler's mom. Like, people were like, they were like, Stifler's mom is hot.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, I'm just really glad the Weitz brothers didn't cast a supermodel for that role because I think they wanted a woman who might be in the neighborhood and not look, you know what I mean, like not a super -- I'm really glad that they went with someone kind of normal, if I am - you know, if I can pull that off. Like, I thought it was like a normal woman that like, you know, just some kid would maybe have a crush on.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Let's go to "The Watcher" now.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: The other -- your other success that's also airing at the same time.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: Excuse me. Did indentured servants build this home, do you know?

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: What? I mean, how would I know?(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's scary.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's creepy.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: I think people love it when it's a true story, and it really did happen to some people. Creepy people are always more interesting than monsters. You know what I mean. Like, if it's any sort of robot or anything -- nothing is creepier than a creepy human.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I think the folks in streaming now have more of an influence on the culture and are even, in some ways, bigger stars than people on the screen, on the big screen, in the box office, I should say, that go to movie theaters.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: I feel like maybe the people that are watching - you know, are streaming these shows and stuff like this aren't as in love with perfection as the previous audience. I make a, you know, a million wrong moves in a day and I think maybe the streaming people like that.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I think you're right about that.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: You do? LEMONrelatable.

utterances.speaker: COOLIDGE
utterances.sentences: No one's ever said I'm right about anything.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You're -(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: She's amazing. Thanks for turning it. And Kaitlan said, can you get Jennifer Coolidge? And I did. I felt challenged to go and interview her.We wanted to have her here on the set, but she can only shoot it down New Orleans (ph).

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: That show is so good. Mike White, Dave Burnett behind it, they're amazing.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And "The Watcher" as well. Both -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What's your mission in life for me, Kaitlan?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Is to get Poppy to watch "White Lotus" because it is that good. And that interview was so good.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Did you -

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Hearing her talk about her career and how it got started. And she was grateful they didn't cast some supermodel. And she looks amazing there.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: She was - yes. Did you watch the first episode of "White Lotus"?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: I haven't watched the first episode of season two -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Of the second season.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Because it was on Sunday, right before we were getting ready for this show.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I watched it last night, by the way.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Good?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's really, really good. You've got to -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: OK. All right, my Saturday night plans.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: The thing is, streaming stars now have just as big an influence or as much impact or more than box office movie stars because everyone is watching streaming and everyone is watching the "White Lotus." HBO Max. And if you don't have it, make sure you sign up. And also "The Watcher" is on Netflix. You can catch that as well.Thank you so much for joining us, everyone. We'll see you back here tomorrow morning. "NEWSROOM" starts right now.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Day two in the books.
